translations.idiomatic: The scholars were all delighted and said, 'Master Shusun is truly a sage—he understands the essential affairs of our time.'

translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year of Han, Gaozu wished to replace the Crown Prince with King Ruyi of Zhao. Shusun Tong admonished the High Emperor, saying, 'Formerly, Duke Xian of Jin deposed the crown prince because of Li Ji and established Xi Qi, causing chaos in Jin that lasted several decades and made them the laughingstock of the empire.'

translations.literal: Qin because not early established Fusu, caused Zhao Gao able to fraudulently establish Hu Hai, self caused extinguish sacrifices, this Your Majesty personally saw.
translations.idiomatic: Qin failed to establish Fusu early, allowing Zhao Gao to fraudulently establish Hu Hai, which caused the Qin sacrifices to be extinguished—this is something Your Majesty witnessed personally.

translations.idiomatic: The current Crown Prince is benevolent and filial—everyone in the empire has heard of this;

translations.idiomatic: The Empress Lü endured hardship and ate meager food alongside Your Majesty—how can you betray her!

translations.literal: Your Majesty must wish depose proper and establish young, minister wishes first receive execution, with neck blood stain ground.'
translations.idiomatic: If Your Majesty insists on deposing the rightful heir and establishing a younger son, I wish to be executed first, staining the ground with my neck blood.'

translations.literal: High Emperor said: 'You stop, I only joking.'
translations.idiomatic: The High Emperor said, 'Enough, you. I was only joking.'

translations.literal: Shusun Tong said: 'Crown Prince tianxia root, root one shake tianxia shakes, how with tianxia as joke!'
translations.idiomatic: Shusun Tong said, 'The Crown Prince is the root of the empire. If the root shakes even once, the whole empire shakes. How can you treat the empire as a joke!'

translations.literal: High Emperor said: 'I listen to your words.'
translations.idiomatic: The High Emperor said, 'I will listen to your words.'

translations.idiomatic: After the High Emperor passed away and Emperor Hui ascended the throne, he said to Master Shusun, 'The assembled ministers are not familiar with the rituals for the late emperor's park tomb and ancestral temple.'

translations.literal: Shusun Sheng memorialized affairs, then requested private audience said: 'Your Majesty why personally build covered walkway high chamber, in robes monthly go out tour high temple?
translations.idiomatic: Master Shusun memorialized on affairs, then requested a private audience and said, 'Why does Your Majesty personally build a covered walkway to the high chamber and, wearing court robes, go out monthly to tour the High Temple?'

translations.idiomatic: The High Temple houses Han's Great Ancestor—how can we allow future generations' descendants to walk above the ancestral temple road!'

translations.literal: Filial Hui Emperor greatly feared, said: 'Urgently destroy it.'

translations.literal: Shusun Sheng said: 'Ruler has no mistaken actions.
translations.idiomatic: Master Shusun said, 'A ruler makes no mistaken actions.'

translations.literal: Now already made, common people all know it, now destroy this, then shows having mistaken action.

translations.literal: Wish Your Majesty establish temple Wei north, in robes monthly go out tour it, moreover expand many ancestral temples, great filial piety's root.'
translations.idiomatic: I wish Your Majesty would establish a temple north of the Wei River and, wearing court robes, go out monthly to tour it. Moreover, expand and increase the ancestral temples—this is the root of great filial piety.'

translations.literal: Filial Hui Emperor once spring went out toured detached palace, Shusun Sheng said: 'Ancient ones had spring tasting fruits, right now cherry ripe, can offer, wish Your Majesty go out, thereby take cherry offer ancestral temple.'

Right now the cherries are ripe and can be offered. I wish Your Majesty would go out and thereby take cherries to offer at the ancestral temple.'

translations.literal: High Emperor then permitted it.
translations.idiomatic: The High Emperor then permitted it.

translations.literal: Three dynasties governance, not one scholar's wisdom.'
translations.idiomatic: The governance of the Three Dynasties was not the wisdom of a single scholar.'

translations.idiomatic: 'The great straight appears bent; the Way is indeed winding'—is this not what it speaks of?
